pull.title: doc: Clarify that CheckSequenceLocksAtTip is a validation function
pull.body: It has been pointed out that a bug in this function can prevent block template creation. ( https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24080#issuecomment-1065148776 ) So it seems that the scope of this function is more than "policy". Rename it back to "validation", to partially revert commit fa4e30b0f36f2e7a09db7d30dca9008ed9dbcb35.

events.body: Could say "mempool validation helper functions" if your intent is to convey that these are only used for validating transactions being {,re-}added to the mempool.

An alternative follow-up suggested to use check the sequence locks before including a tx in a template. (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24080#issuecomment-1065366812)

As that requires reading the utxo set, I am not sure about the performance impact. So I'll leave it for a follow-up.

events.message: Clarify that CheckSequenceLocksAtTip is a validation function

events.body: Concept NACK: Block template creation IS mere policy.
Maybe we need a separate word to describe block templates that are consensus invalid? It doesn't seem policy nor consensus, so I picked "validation".

ACK fa8671018766b2f0e18c94cff3ab2a67c6b3a41d

I agree this is clearer.
ACK fa8671018766b2f0e18c94cff3ab2a67c6b3a41d - looks fine to me
